Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of RF neck amphora. Smikros (Ohly-Dumm (1974)); Euphronios (Ohly-Dumm (1986)). Last quarter sixth. 510-500 (so also Hamdorf in `Euphronios').
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: Above the head: Φειδι̣[αδες], or Φειδι̣[αδες καλος].
Record.CAVI-Comments: The same name occurs on Brussels A 717 and, with kalos, on London E 438, both by Smikros.
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} the entry precedes 1986, as it gives only the attribution to Smikros.

Record.CAVI-Lemma: RF neck amphora. Related to Manner of Euphronios. Late sixth. 515-510 (Bothmer).
Record.CAVI-Subject: A: the top of the head and the end of flutes of a flautist. B: part of a male with his himation over the right shoulder.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: A: above the flautist's head: Σμινδυριδε̣ς{1}. B: To left of the figure, not facing him: [Γλαυκ]υτες κα[λος]{2}.
Record.CAVI-Comments: + New York 1985.228.8 + four additional Louvre frs. For the name Smindyrides cf. the pretentious contender from Sybaris for the hand of Agariste, Hdt. 6.127.1. Our Smindyrides must be an aulist who took on the name of the famous one. Bothmer compares the dwarf Hippokleides. Glaukytes: cf. the Acropolis plaque related to Euthymides, ARV[2] 1598/5, where the name is substituted for Megakles, with Bothmer's very interesting comments in `Euphronios' (both editions).
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} very clear in the photo, p. 129. Add.[2] has Μινδυριδες: the sigma is on a fr. added later. {2} small in photo, p. 129. I do not understand where the beginning of [Glauk]ytes was: the picture shows a large BG area preceding the extant letters. Bothmer does not comment. Was the first half of the name on the other side of the figure? Is this tag-kalos?
Record.AVI-Bibliography: ARV[2] (1963), 18, bottom (mention; Louvre Cp 11,187 only). — Add.[2] (1989), 153 and 395. — Bothmer (1990a), 128/16 (ill.). — Berlin Antikenmuseum (1991), 142/16 (exc. photos of inscriptions, p. 143, esp. of the Smindyrides).

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fragmentary RF Nolan amphora From Nola. Nikon Painter (HRI). Second quarter fifth. Ca. 460.
Record.CAVI-Subject: A: Nike at a tripod on a three-stepped base.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: A: on the top step of the tripod base: Ακαμαντις | ενικ̣α φυλε. On the bottom step: Γλαυκων καλος.
Record.CAVI-Comments: Pickard-Cambridge(2), Davies and Webster think Glaukon won a choral victory of his tribe, but Glaukon is a very common kalos-name in this period (see AttScr (1990), 100 n. 10). The same(?) victory is remembered on Athens, Acr. 504 (RF). The victory inscription is Attic, the kalos-inscription, Ionic. The same handwriting is found on Boston 68.163 [see Para. 402-403], which has Γλαυκων καλος, Ionic, on a herm and Charmides kalos in the field in Attic letters. Since that vase is attributed to the Nikon Painter, I think London E 298 should also be, as the letter forms are identical.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: CIG 4 (1855–77), no. 7806. — Kretschmer (1894), 92. — H.B. Walters and E.J. Forsdyke, CVA London 5, Great Britain 7 (1930), III I c, pl. 51,1. — ARV[2] (1963), 1581/20. — Pickard-Cambridge (1968), 78, n. 4, fig. 31. — J.K. Davies (1971), 91. — Para. (1971), 403, 523. — Webster (1972), 48-49. — Francis–Vickers (1981), 109, fig. 2. — Add.[2] (1989), 389. — AttScr (1990), no. 680, fig. 128.
